markdownRemark.html:
Sometimes Scala compiler errors can be too cryptic and scare beginners away

{% gist 7aece353b1e9e01dbaaba7ca1c7505a2 error1.scala %}

Or

{% gist 7aece353b1e9e01dbaaba7ca1c7505a2 error2.scala %}

What if we could have right now an human friendly explanation of the error, similar to what Elm{:target="blank"} or React{:target="blank"} do? (Well, even Scala itself with Dotty{:target="_blank"} will have it but in the future)

Scala Clippy{:target="_blank"} is a compiler (or SBT) plugin that does just that.

Just import it in your project

{% gist 7aece353b1e9e01dbaaba7ca1c7505a2 clippy.scala %}

and the previous error magically becomes

{% gist 7aece353b1e9e01dbaaba7ca1c7505a2 clippy-error.scala %}

But there is no magic, it's all community driven.
When first started Clippy will download the current advice list from
scala-clippy.org{:target="_blank"}.
It's community driven so you can also contribute!

For more detailed instructions on how to setup just visit the Clippy github repository{:target="_blank"}

Keep Learning
Until next time
